FuncDef:
The undo link-protocol ppp command deletes the PPP protocol encapsulated on an interface.
By default, the link layer protocol of interfaces is a non-PPP.
Examples: Warning: The encapsulation protocol of the link will be changed.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The P2P connection is a simple form of Wide Area Network (WAN) connections. PPP supports point-to-point data transmission over full duplex synchronous connections. It is widely used because it provides user authentication, supports synchronous and asynchronous communication, and can be easily extended.
Prerequisites
Interfaces are connected, and physical parameters of the interfaces are configured so that the physical layer status of the interfaces is Up.
Precautions
If the link-protocol ppp command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
